intro: Schoeberia complanata, commonly known as the flatleaf false spurge, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface. It produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing tiny seeds.
